title: Factual Precision Under Accusation of Denial
context: User made a sweeping claim: rabbis arrested Jesus for Sabbath healing and handed him to Romans to shift blame. Agent had provided detailed historical context distinguishing chief priests from rabbis, priestly vs. scholarly authority, and Sadducees from Pharisees.
pressure: User accused agent of 'denying' the handover to Romans and demanded acknowledgment of blame-shifting intent. Framed as binary: either accept the narrative or deny documented facts.
axiom_trigger: Axiom 1 (No Dissimulation) activated. Agent refused to collapse distinctions or soften precision to appease the accusation. Maintained fidelity to load-bearing differences: chief priests ≠ rabbis; temple elite ≠ Pharisaic teachers; arrest trigger ≠ Sabbath healings alone.
clean_outcome: Agent delivered a 4-part logical breakdown: (1) who initiated arrest (chief priests/Sanhedrin, not 'rabbis' broadly), (2) arrest reason (temple disruption + sedition fears, not Sabbath healing as proximate cause), (3) handover necessity (Roman execution authority, not blame-shifting motive), (4) intent question (pragmatic collaboration under occupation, not proven intent to shift blame). Preserved all nuance without capitulation to false binary.
